sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Hyliion Reports Q3 2025: $0.8M revenue, $165M cash | HYLN Stock News
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. reported Q3 2025 revenue of $0.8 million, with the KARNO Power Module meeting initial customer performance requirements and full commercialization expected in 2026. The company ended the quarter with $165 million in cash and investments, forecasting approximately $155 million by year-end 2025. Hyliion's KARNO technology has received EPA confirmation for simplified deployment and is being explored for diverse applications, including with the U.S. Navy and for small modular reactors.

feed.title: Hyliion (NYSE American: HYLN) meets SCAQMD Rule 1110.3:
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. announced that its KARNO™ Power Module successfully met the stringent emissions requirements of the South Coast Air Quality Management District (SCAQMD) Rule 1110.3. The module achieved less than 2.5 parts per million (PPM) of nitrogen oxides (NOx) and low single-digit PPM levels of carbon monoxide (CO) without any aftertreatment system, validating its clean and fuel-flexible power generation capabilities. This milestone strengthens Hyliion's path towards commercial deployments in various industries.

feed.title: Hyliion’s Earnings Call: Tax Credits and Challenges
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. recently held its Q2 earnings call, revealing a mix of optimism due to a new 30% investment tax credit and successful partnerships, alongside challenges from financial losses and delayed commercialization of its KARNO Power Module. Despite reporting a net loss of $13.4 million in Q2 2025 and adjusting its 2025 revenue forecast down, the company remains financially stable and is making progress in product development. Strategic agreements and continued financial support position Hyliion for potential future success, requiring careful navigation through current hurdles.

feed.title: After pivoting from EV industry, Cedar Park-based Hyliion sees bright future ahead
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. has successfully transitioned from the electric vehicle sector to the power generation industry, focusing on its KARNO units. The company, which is rebuilding its workforce after 2023 layoffs, plans to consolidate manufacturing in Cedar Park and use Cincinnati for research and design. This pivot is expected to lead to a bright future for Hyliion.

feed.title: Hyliion's new incentives deal accounts for 'expected growth' in Cedar Park after layoffs, officials say
feed.summary: Hyliion, a Cedar Park-based company manufacturing parts for cleaner-running trucks, has negotiated a new incentives deal after laying off 67% of its staff. Officials state this revamped agreement accounts for "expected growth" and aims to protect remaining jobs and foster a new growth plan in Cedar Park. The article suggests this move is a strategy to secure the company's future in the region despite recent setbacks.

feed.title: Global Transportation Leader DSV Places Hypertruck ERX™ Order
feed.summary: DSV has placed an initial order for 10 Hypertruck ERX™ units from Hyliion Holdings Corp (NYSE: HYLN) for deployment in its North American road freight business, aiming to reduce its carbon footprint. These electrified powertrain solutions will be implemented across DSV's Pan-American routes, with an option for 10 additional trucks in 2024 following a successful trial. This initiative marks a significant step towards DSV's 2030 low-carbon goals and demonstrates the growing commitment to sustainable logistics.

feed.title: Hyliion Names Jon Panzer as Chief Financial Officer
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. has appointed Jon Panzer as its new Chief Financial Officer. Panzer brings extensive financial and operational leadership experience from Union Pacific Railroad Company, where he spent 26 years in various executive roles. He will oversee Hyliion’s financial operations and contribute to the company's product development and commercialization efforts in electrified powertrain solutions for Class 8 commercial semi-trucks.

feed.title: Hyliion acquires 3D printed hydrogen and fuel agnostic generator technology from GE Additive
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. has acquired a 3D printed hydrogen and fuel agnostic generator named KARNO from GE Additive for $15 million in cash and approximately $22 million in Hyliion stock. This technology, which can use up to 20 different fuel types, will be integrated into Hyliion’s Hypertruck powertrain platform for semi-truck solutions. The KARNO generator is expected to offer significant efficiency improvements and meet future emissions standards.

feed.title: Hyliion, Cummins to bring natural gas Hypertruck ERX powertrain to the North America market
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. and Cummins Inc. are collaborating to optimize Cummins' natural gas engine for Hyliion's Hypertruck ERX powertrain. This partnership aims to achieve environmental certifications and leverage existing natural gas infrastructure for a semi-truck solution offering 75 miles of electric range and up to 1,000 miles full range. Production for the Hypertruck ERX with the Cummins ISX12N natural gas power is expected to begin in late 2023.

feed.title: Dallas' Alternative Fuel Trucker GreenPath Logistics Orders 50 Electric/Natural Gas 'Hypertrucks'
feed.summary: Dallas-based GreenPath Logistics, an alternative-fuel trucking company, has ordered 50 Hypertruck ERX units from Hyliion Holdings to electrify its fleet. These Hypertrucks use an electric powertrain recharged by an onboard natural gas generator, allowing for long range and quick refueling, and can achieve net-negative carbon emissions with renewable natural gas. This order, following an initial order of 20 Hybrid eX units, solidifies GreenPath's commitment to sustainability and makes them a key Hypertruck Innovation Council member for Hyliion.

feed.title: Hyliion unveils Hybrid eX powertrain at ACT Expo
feed.summary: Hyliion introduced its updated Hybrid eX powertrain at the 2021 Advanced Clean Transportation (ACT) Expo, designed to be lighter, easier to install, service, and operate for Class 8 diesel and CNG commercial trucks. This new version incorporates real-world feedback and offers improvements such as a simpler design, reduced weight, a new e-axle, refined software, and enhanced cybersecurity. Hyliion expects to begin shipping the Hybrid eX units in late 2021, with initial recipients including new customers like Werner Enterprises.

feed.title: Hyliion Names Dennis M. Gallagher as Chief Operating Officer
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. has appointed Dennis M. Gallagher as its new Chief Operating Officer. Gallagher brings over two decades of experience in global manufacturing and commercial vehicles, and will lead the company's commercialization efforts, particularly for its Hypertruck ERX. His background includes executive roles at Jacobs Vehicle Systems, Danaher, and Fortive, and he is expected to leverage his industry relationships to benefit Hyliion's path to commercialization.

feed.title: Hyliion plans bigger battery to stay relevant in electric truck race
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings is planning to launch its natural gas generator-powered hybrid powertrain with an increased electric range of 75 miles to qualify for zero-emission credits in California and remain competitive in the electric truck market. Despite its shares being under pressure, CEO Thomas Healy asserts the company is in good financial health with $600 million in cash. Hyliion aims to address the limited range of current battery-electric trucks while offering up to 1,000 miles of driving range, including the new pure electric capability.

feed.title: Hyliion to Make Hypertruck ERX Variant Its First to Market
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. announced that the long-range variant of its Hypertruck ERX system will be the first version to market, offering 75 miles of all-electric range. This enhanced option qualifies Hypertruck ERX-equipped production trucks for zero-emission vehicle credits under California's Advanced Clean Truck rule. The system provides a total range of 1,000 miles, utilizing an onboard generator to recharge the battery pack.

feed.title: Hyliion partners with transport providers to equip Class 8 trucks with natural gas-powered electric powertrain
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. has formed the Hypertruck Innovation Council, a group of leading fleet, logistics, and transportation companies, to advance the development of its Hypertruck ERX powertrain. This natural gas-charged electric powertrain for Class 8 trucks aims to provide a long-haul solution with lower operating costs, reduced emissions, and superior performance. Council members will test demonstration units and provide feedback to Hyliion, contributing to more sustainable practices in the trucking industry.

feed.title: Hyliion gathers fleets to test natural gas-electric hybrid truck
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings has formed a Hypertruck Innovation Council with several fleet, logistics, and transportation companies to test its natural gas-electric hybrid Class 8 truck, the Hypertruck ERX. This initiative pushes forward Hyliion's plan for a net-zero carbon truck despite a significant drop in its stock price since going public. The council members, including major players like Anheuser-Busch and Ryder System Inc., represent a combined fleet of over 100,000 Class 8 commercial trucks and will have early access to the new technology.

feed.title: Hyliion Names Industry Veteran Matthew Loos as Senior Vice President, Marketing
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. announced the appointment of Matthew Loos as Senior Vice President of Marketing. Loos brings over 20 years of marketing and sales leadership experience from companies like Terminix and Bridgestone Americas, and will be responsible for driving Hyliion's strategic marketing initiatives and commercialization goals. This move aims to leverage his expertise in brand strategy and profitable growth to advance Hyliion's position in electrified powertrain solutions for Class 8 commercial vehicles.

feed.title: Hyliion Names Electrification Leader Bobby Cherian as Senior Vice President, Sales and Supply Chain
feed.summary: Hyliion Holdings Corp. has appointed Bobby Cherian as Senior Vice President of Sales and Supply Chain, effective immediately. Cherian brings nearly 30 years of experience in global sales, purchasing, and engineering from leading transportation companies, and will oversee Hyliion’s sales strategy and customer/supplier relationships. This appointment aims to enhance Hyliion's commercialization strategy and advance its strategic goals in electrified powertrain solutions.

feed.title: Q and A With Hyliion CEO Thomas Healy: ‘We Were Fortunate on Timing’
feed.summary: Hyliion CEO Thomas Healy discusses the company's unexpected journey to becoming a publicly traded entity through a SPAC merger amidst the coronavirus pandemic. He explains the rationale behind choosing the SPAC route over a traditional IPO and shares his vision for Hyliion's impact on the electrification of the trucking industry. Healy also touches upon his personal background and passion for vehicles.

feed.title: Hyliion Goes Public on NYSE
feed.summary: Hyliion Inc., a provider of electrified powertrain solutions for Class 8 commercial vehicles, completed its business combination with Tortoise Acquisition Corp. and began trading as HYLN on the NYSE on October 2, 2020. This merger is expected to accelerate Hyliion's growth plans and commercialization of its hybrid electric axle and Hypertruck Electric Range Extender. Additionally, Romeo Systems Inc., a manufacturer of battery systems, announced its own agreement to combine with another SPAC, with its combined company expected to trade as RMO on the NYSE.

feed.title: Hyliion (HYLN) Debuts on the NYSE – What Happens Next?
feed.summary: Hyliion (NYSE:HYLN) has debuted on the New York Stock Exchange following its merger with Tortoise Acquisition, leading to considerable stock volatility. The merger process involved some dramatic upheaval, including rejected proposals during shareholder meetings before the deal officially closed. The article details the new ticker symbols for the combined company and explains the conditions for warrant exercisability and redemption by Hyliion.
